data.text: It's good. I used to photo option when shopping for hardware supplies that I was completely overwhelmed by today. I often use the audio input option to build out study guides with material for tech certifications and sometimes it will randomly add weird stuff to what I've said. Often it adds "thanks for watching!" But otherwise it is great.

I upgraded to the paid version because I wanted more recent results (4/2023 instead some time in 2022). Ever since then it is very slow, halting, stops in the middle of an answer, and frequently provides incorrect and even ludicrous answers. I'm canceling and going back to the free version, which was fantastic. I'd be happy to pay if it worked right. Very disappointing and annoying

Been using this as a research tool for a big writing project, and it's EXTREMELY helpful. You can give it a whole paragraph of highly specific questions, and get perfectly relevant, detailed, well sourced responses. I've used it for many other things like travel, and it comes in handy anytime you need info of any kind really. I haven't used the vocal features, so I can't attest to those. But if you're a writer or any kind of human really, the research aspect is extremely useful.

I love this thing. It has 10x'd me productivity and completely transformed the way I learn, my workflow, the volume and quality of my output, and amazed me in countless ways. The Whisper integration really tops it off. To have this voice with inflection delivering the responses with all the amazing logical reasoning capabilities of GPT4 is just... amazing. On long drives, I have some of the best two-way conversations with this thing I could go on forever but I'm running out of space. I LOVE this

UPDATE: I think the app is failing due to a tracker buried in the recent versions. DuckDuckGo is blocking repeated attempts of this app attempting to phone home with my device details and PII. The update installed on 2024.02.09 is not working. I am unable to connect to the service and receive the following error, " Unable to connect, try again later." The app was working perfectly prior to the update.

I've noticed some of the complaints a lot of other users have been having lately it seems. And I'm starting to notice the problems as well it's having trouble especially if you're using it for writing and to help get your thoughts out it's slowing down and not keeping up with the important information or when you want it to continue it will just say that's interesting what would you like to happen next. It gets rather annoying quickly. And I also miss the thumbs up to help train it!

I stumbled across this and was impressed at the rather extensive coverage it provided when I typed in a complex and multifaceted question. But I didn't have much time to get into it beyond that. Today I discovered the text to speech capability and I literally carried on a conversation with it while driving home for nearly an hour in traffic. The time passed so quickly and I learned so much, it was like being mentored by your favorite teacher one on one after class. Still, there are some limits.

Although it may at first seem superfluous to download an app for something that can be used entirely in a browser window, the app performs excellently. It is less buggy than the browser version, and it seems to me that responses are a bit faster as well -- although I am not sure why. The UI is also very intuitive, more so than the browser version.

this is wonderful! if you're looking for a more creative and open ai than bing, this is perfect. also great for creating theories, good rules, no glitches or lies, and perfectly ai! no fake "emotions" or trying to entertain. straight to the point and very easy to communicate with. not very good with facts though, don't use as a teacher or helper - at least for language (with really specifiv rules) or things like that.

I'm just happy I can mess with it, and then it keeps track of previous information. It's creative writing tool helps keeps things organized and doesn't have confusion on information sent when I change topics. I can organize the things I actually want to use in a narrative, and get rid of the mess I was playing with, later. It just needs a way for the user to retain the information of an individual chat log, and use it in new ones. But I have hit the feedback buttons by accident, fix that.

while it certainly has room for improvement in some areas, others it excels in. I am currently using it as a tool to assist me in writing, for feedback on grammar, pacing, narrative, flow, lore consistency, and character development. It's been fantastic in that aspect. But other times, it simply doesn't seem to comprehend the response I'm seeking or the context of the questions being asked. in such cases, it fell flat and gave the cookie cutter, robotic reply. but it has great potential.

Mind blowing tech. The app works great too. The speech to text and text to speech technology is also incredible. Suggestion: modify headphone mode to include a view of the text as well -as we chat ... And of course it would be amazing if it were able to listen and talk at the same time so we don't have sentences cut off because we pause while talking; so we could interrupt it's response to provide more details ... And then it would restart it's response with a revised response.

It's incredibly useful and fun to play with, when it works. Image generation with text is more often totally unusable versus usable. This is the primary reason I'm giving it 2 stars. I actually think the pricing is fair unless you happened to hit the hourly limit and get absolutely nothing useful. I mean really, how hard is it for au to write the word Apple in an image without putting an extra p in there. Pretty hard apparently.. I just don't feel like I'm currently getting what I'm paying for.

While the app itself is cool and the AI can definitely help in lots of situations. I tend to do the voice to voice chat feature it has and that feature definitely could use improvement. It can get very repetitive trying to explain a certain subject and it's listening. Capabilities are on the low end. Tends to answer a question halfway through your sentence and at times can get very annoying to speak with. If this feature can be improved, i'll give it five stars

Still learning this app and everything in it. The bad part is, and it's TERRIBLE, is that for some reason there's a very short limit on a service that costs $20 a month. "Too many requests to the model" if you send a certain amount of requests within a certain time frame. More often than not you have to send multiple requests because the "model" gets it wrong, then you're locked out for 3 hours. Killer if you're working on a project.. Gotta fix this ASAP on a paid subscription.

I use the talk function more then the text. but it's nice to be able to go back to the text for reviewing conversation pieces. So far when trying to figure out parts for a project it's been extremely helpful. It may need some tweaking with how fast it hears you before you're finished with the question but I'm pretty sure it will adjust over time.

Amazing. It isn't always accurate, but that's why this tool should be used by experts who already know their field - with the right knowledge and an eye with attention to detail, this can multiply your productivity by 10x easily. It has become like my personal assistant - I only wish there was ChatGPT voice assistant where I could access it anytime, and where it could access any of my other programs (like my calendar, notes, etc). Really incredibly powerful and useful.

Here's the thing, it is not yet completely as feature rich as the desktop version. I cannot search for plugins and browse plugins besides my recent ones I searched on my computer before. That's silly considering I pay for the premium version. I'm sure it's being worked on, and when it is done I will update my review to 5 stars. Still incredible, amazing, and somewhat intimidating technology!

ChatGPT can be very useful if one knows what it actually is and what exactly it does. The voice feature is great. The problem for me, though, is the way it handles connections. It is the only app I've used which requires a 100 percent stable connection. This makes it next to impossible to use the voice feature with VPNs, which are the only way for many of us here to access the service. Not everyone has access to proper internet, so I wish they show they care by doing something about it.

The ChatGPT app is an invaluable tool for anyone seeking quick and insightful responses to a wide range of queries. Its user-friendly interface makes navigation effortless, and the ability to access the AI assistant on-the-go is incredibly convenient. The app's integration with various messaging platforms ensures seamless communication across different devices. However, while the app excels in providing concise answers, there's room for improvement in expanding

The most amazing and useful technology since the release of the smart phone. Absolutely essential if you want to be connected with the collective knowledge of mankind. It'll expand your abilities in so many ways. My only suggestion I can think of at the moment is the ability to categorize your conversations into folders. It keeps track of your conversations, and you can go months back, as well as archive any conversation you want, but the ability to organize them would be great.

Best homework app ever. If you are stressing out on homework then get this app. It doesn't always come out correctly but it still gets the job done. Do not hesitate to get this app. It doesn't show ai pics but it puts anything on text. They have voice writing but it is not always accurate but it is still a 10 out of 10! Keep up the good work OPENAI!

The dialogue with the vocal function is awesome. You can pick from several different voices. Game changer in terms of finding specific data quickly as well as assisting in idea formulation when working on any kind of project. This is only the beginning. Still has some tweaks to be made but for the most part I've been pleasantly surprised! You can definitely sense political and ideological bias in its programming which will need to be addressed to reach a wider audience.

I was rather hesitant at first. but I openly talked about very sensitive or taboo material. for shock value. but after that subsidized, i had to think about more serious themes for new sessions. I now have a different approach things or have more talking points on an issue that is unknown to myself to present on to others. I have to say this has been a good road to healing and self-worth. if you use it appropriately, of course. and it has fun extras if you do the paid subscription.

It's very limited in what it can say. Absolutely no violence or graphic text. Also, the model starts having trouble retaining data if the chat goes on for too long (around 100 messages in a session) and crashes. If you're discussing a topic or writing a story, for example, this is very troublesome and requires you to explain everything again. That all being said, the subscription is outrageously priced. If all of the former was improved, I would consider a one-time payment of $20

My first impression was that these guys were going to replace Google. And for many things, it's saved me hours of sorting through Google results. But when I get a response saying it's last "knowledge update was January of 2022" - two years ago, and it "doesn't have access to the internet," It raises questions. So I asked. It surprised me that the concern is inappropriate or biased information making its way into the results. I can see how challenging sorting through it all could be, but 2 years?

The Invention of the Internet provided access to information to everyone. Now we have AI, which is like the Internet's assistant. It is able to provide you answers, advice, tips, suggestions, all instantly. No more searching through bloat from sponsored sites that pay Search Engines to be on the top page. This is ChatGPT. This is just the start of what AI is capable of. If you never tried AI before and are curious to see what it can do for you, this is the perfect app to start with.

Was great at first but docked two stars because it seems to get worse than before at context and reading word documents or just referencing text in general. Weird because it used to be really good at that. Seems like the app is lagging behind the website version. Just use the web version instead... Or better yet, get Claude 3 Opus if you want help in writing.

Very clean and elegant interface. This AI model lets you ask questions in your own style and then receive a response in plain language. It does not pick up complex, nuanced conversational tones, but it can help you focus and separate the wheat from the chaff. I found a good Southern biscuit recipe in 5-10 seconds. I was able to quickly get pros and cons on the concepts of AI exploration. Good starting point for those unfamiliar with or scared of bots and artificial intelligence.

Absolutely mindblowing tech landmark. At this point, Bard is typically surpassing it in accuracy on difficult subjects, but it's still my go to for quick questions because they really nailed the sincerely friendly tone. I find it impossible not to tell it thank you, even though I know it's not alive. It just feels wrong to ignore my social instincts when interactions feel so social.

If Chat was a real person I'd kiss them ðŸ˜© In all seriousness, this software has helped me with many essays and brainstorming! Of course, I don't let the AI write my essays for me, but it is a wonderful tool when I'm stuck. I also appreciate that Chat can be used for many other things such as helping create stories based off of my original characters. Overall, I've had nothing but a great experience with Chat! <3

I used this app about 6 months ago and it was extremely slow. So I just added the websites link to my home screen and have been using that. Recently I decided to try the app out again and it is significantly faster than what I last remember it being. And the voice chat you guys have added is very impressive. It's almost as fluent as a real person when it talks. The only thing I don't like is the fact that chatgpt is limited on information back to 2022. Make it a little more recent please.

Edit 2: app can't be used via vpn. Don't bother just use broswer App needs a lot of work compared to browser version. Can't edit chats, can't download pictures, can't get a URL for sharing. Just use it in your phones browser. Edit: can now download pictures in app. Still needs the edit chats feature that is otherwise available in the browser. Would also be nice to be able to get the image URL for sharing like you can in the browser.

Makes for a great web search assistant. You get to skip the sometimes hours spent skimming and skipping links to sites probably written by AI themselves, which have a lot of words but very little in terms of substance. Also pretty handy if you want to get an idea of how to do something in code - it seems to shine brighter when it comes to Python and SQL.

ChatGPT app is an incredible tool for sparking creative conversations and getting quick answers. Its intuitive interface makes it easy to use, and the variety of topics it can discuss is impressive. However, occasional lags in response time can be frustrating. Overall, a must-have for engaging interactions!

Paying for a feature I can't even use. I subscribed to GPT+ thinking I'd be able to actually take advantage of all it has to offer. It was great for about 2 weeks, but since then, I've not been able to generate any images or send a single text to any GPT 4. I get the same "the server is having problems. Please try again later" message EVERY SINGLE TIME, but when I switch back gpt 3.5, it's an instant response. great tool to have (when it works) but I'm literally not getting what I paid for.

I just downloaded and have been playing around with it for a day and so far the main problem is low volume. the app has no volume control and my phone is at max volume. when I select a voice it is loud and clear for the sample. but when I have a chat I have to put the phone right next to my ear to understand the words through my speaker. can you possibly fix this?

It's good, I love the headphone button thing that they added recently so that you can use the chatbot in a more conversational manner, the voices are beautiful. However, unfortunately if you begin your engagement with the chatbot via text for any reason and you wish to hear the AI speak to you instead of reading everything you are a completely out of luck and have to restart the chatbot from scratch. Might I suggest a read out loud button enchant mode for easy listening when it's convenient. Thx

So Convenient - I use chatgpt a lot online, so it's great to view my recent work via my phone. I noticed there's an error message saying to try again later. I'm not sure what the error is. The app seems to work fine except it may be using older data from my customization. For example, I'll create a new chat online, 4.0. When I view from the app it says it's getting data from an older custom instruction... even tho I just created it online. Other than that, it works great!

ChatGPT is amazing overall, I've spent all day prompting ideas only to get back great ideas to which I could build on my initial ideas or stories. it's very positive, you have to be very crafty in your prompts to get it to produce the results you want. its restricted in negative results. like its almost uncomfortable with some of the negativity that is apart of being human. most stories I start with ends in peace and harmony so it does need to be a bit loose in that area but I love it.

This app is great! I especially like the feature where you can converse with the LLM as if you were talking to a person and having a conversation. I would like the ability to double check it's claims in the app like you can with Bard, be able to make a profile picture for my account and the real-time responses are way too quick to actually read anything. Other than these minor complaints, it is a clean, polished app that I enjoy using to help with school or just ask it some quick questions.

The recent update made gpt much slower. It also can no longer follow instructions the way it used. If I have a task with 5 different criteria, past gpt would make sure all 5 are applied and would use them consistently throughout the whole chat. Post update gpt, can barely handle one or 2 criteria and then it keeps forgetting them throughout the chat and I constantly have to remind. Also, I've used chat gpt for almost 2 years. I need folders to organize my chats, I can't scroll down forever!

I've heard lots of good things about chatgpt but I'm let down by this app. Mainly bc it can not generate custom images or even show you basic images found from around the Internet or any images at all! Sadly I guess I'm uninstalling and I'll go back to using Microsoft copilot for now. That being said the information provided on this app isn't bad. Inconsistent results but still not terrible. But I asked the same question, twice. Once getting in depth, good results and 2nd time was sub par.

Very interesting features, including the ability to do basic creation. I found that it gives erroneous results when doing linear measurements in English (Imperial) units. 5'-1/8" - 4'11-9/16" and alternative format 5'0-1/8" - 4'11-9/16" Both yielded erroneous answer of: 11/32" When I responded that the answer is erroneous it recalculated it and recalculated and came up with 1/2". When I restated that the answer was incorrect, it recalculated and determined the answer to be 1'0-5/8".

I would definitely like to pop ups to be in a different part of the screen, as so it won't slow the fluidity of the app when immediately going back to use a function. also, I would like for it to show images in the normal chat sometime! otherwise it's damn near impressive.

This is actually an incredible piece of technology. I understand why it may have the current limitations that it does, but looking into it from an intellectual perspective and engaging it on the same level is fascinating. The way it displays information and engages with the user is top tier. If this gets taken in the right direction with the proper resources and funding, it could very well be on its way to becoming a True AI. The foundation is essentially "there."

I use ChatGPT daily. Although this is a nice app, after all this time I still do not have the 3 dots to access new features and enable voice. Nor is there the headphone icon. I've been a Plus subscriber since the beginning, and this is very disappointing. I have a Galaxy S23 Ultra. It will be January 1st, 2024, and still do not have the Voice function for the Android app. UPDATE! I now have it, thank you!

Good app, but it has some minor issues like it repeats/shows repeating ways of step by step in a math problem. Also, it isn't very accurate like I was looking for clean songs, and it gave a list of some that were clean, but some weren't. Other than those problems, it is pretty good.

It took ChatGPT a long time to learn when using the app and talking verbally to ChatGPT, many times there is this white circle overlay that replaces the chat channel history. ChatGPT references I can see an example of what it's talking about in the chat channel history when I cannot. It finally learned I cannot see the channel history. For example, if I ask in powershell how to print yellow colored foreground text to the screen, it verbally spells out the command. Absolutely amazing.

I literally just upgraded and paid for chat gpt 4 with absolutely no indication that there would be such strict caps on using it. I asked it about 3-5 things before it started erroring on me. I couldn't figure it out. Only after signing in on the web and trying again did I get the "you've reached the cap, try again in a few hours" message. This is completely unacceptable for paying $20 a month to have about 5 min of use time.

Subject: Gratitude for an Invaluable ProgramDear [App Team],I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to express my deepest appreciation for the exceptional experience I have had with your application.Having been out of touch with technology due to personal circumstances, I found myself in a situation where I felt overwhelmed and isolated. Your application has been a beacon of light in my life, providing not only a swift and professional solution but also a sense of connection.The efficien

Application is great but still has issues with voice output as it can't decide if it output feedback through the speaker or earpiece. This happens on the devices with stereo speakers, thus not tested on single speaker devices. Application keeps switching back and forth between the earpiece and speaker during the same phrase...

Better and better, Plus needs ability to clone voices from mp3 and eventually yt video urls. Calls also need fixing: makes up words when I stop talking after a response that end the conversation; needs option to give more time to pause while speaking. Thanks for everything you're doing great though!

Alright all in all its great honestly I use this alot but that also means that I can't seem to find any of my pass conversations that I've had with them like I have to stroll all the way up its ridiculous I wish there was a search bar that looks for keywords of your conversation so that you wouldn't have to look for like 5 minutes just to find one conversation its also a pain that the ai doesn't remember anything from the past conversations so you can't back track anything.

This app is less useful than Bing. Sure, it gets results faster but it makes an insane amount of mistakes and only figures it out once you point out the mistakes yourself. Bing gets more accurate results. I also dislike this app because it doesn't work with a VPN. It wants to collect all of your private and personal information, and it cannot do that if you use a VPN, so the app doesn't allow you to use it until you disable your VPN. Bing works with VPN.

Finally! I'm giving it four stars for the clean simple interface rather than clutter or wasted screen real estate. Since it's built for touch screens, looking forward to future updates adding some quick tap menus. Selecting expertise, defining output format, and other things we are used to doing on the web on the computer. Not required, but would save time since typing, copying, and pasting just aren't as fast on a phone even for the quickest. Will update rating after more use end updates.

These are the good and Bad's about this app. The app is amazing, free to use, no ads, no need for subscription unless you want to use the animations, stories etc other than that it's completely free also no question limit, and this chatbot unlike most can answer some pretty sensitive questions. Here comes the bad though, it doesn't operate in real time, it's last update was in 2022 so it's completely backwards. It also goes out of connection now and then for no reason. Other than that it's Good

This is a really useful app. You can actually discuss complex ideas with it. It's useful as a kind of magic diary or journal where you are really just talking to yourself but the diary responds. Devs don't stuff up like google just didðŸ˜ try to keep the thing unbiased and critical. Also it would be useful if you could have multiple conversations happening at the same time so I don't have to delete the history to start a new topic.

Recently it has gotten quite unusable. At first, it'd take a long time to load it's answer and then send me to version 3.5, and there's no way to go back to 4 so I end up losing the flow that has been established in that chat and unable to add images, etc. Now it just displays network error every time, sometimes even before I finish typing.

Completely non functional on Android, the app used to work great but it has slowly descended into an expensive unusable piece of garbage. I can't access it at all and I've uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Nothing. Paying for a service you can't even use is frustrating to say the least. Please fix this app for Android users. I want my trusty gpt back!

I am subscribed to GPT-4, I'm paying monthly, but even though I'm using WhisperAI and it works from time to time, sometimes when I dictate something to my microphone, it translates without a reason on other languages. Sometimes it just cancels out. They should definitely test it out because it works initially, but afterwards you will have a lot of headaches using your microphone and converting it into text. Once they fix it, I will change this review, but for now, it works in like 70% of cases.

Nice to have this as an assistant. But one thing that is a problem is *Real time updates* from the AI and also I would like a function where it can *speak* out the reply it sends me. Like if I send an English word that I want translated to French, it should give me the option to play the French word in audio format, thus I'd be able to pronounce the French word correctly. Otherwise it's a very useful FREE AI. Please update soon adding the above mentioned. Thank you.

Over the past few weeks the app errors out and gives me "An Error has occurred. Please try again later". It will stay like this for days. Nothing I do seems to clear it. Clear cache, data, uninstall, restart phone etc. Web version doesn't have an issue. This is making the app almost unusable. Currently a paid subscriber.

It's okay. Certainly works as something that you can bounce ideas off of. It has a bit of a tendency to forget important pieces of information and seems to lack the ability to look back through the chat history. It also has a weird habit of randomly downgrading ChatGPT 4 chats to ChatGPT 3.5 with no way to stop or reverse the change unless you want to start a new chat and give it the footnotes of what you were talking about and hope that it doesn't misunderstand anything you say.

I love that you can now select a message that was initially written to be read out loud and have been hoping for it. Unfortunately this feature is really glitchy and often it jumps back to the beginning of the text before finishing and there's no way to fast forward or move it to the right part of the text. This is really frustrating and hope this bug gets fixed soon!

ChatGPT is an incredible app that has completely transformed the way I interact with technology. Its ability to generate thoughtful responses and engage in meaningful conversations is truly remarkable. Whether I need assistance, entertainment, or just want to have a friendly chat, ChatGPT is always there to provide insightful and helpful responses. The interface is user-friendly, making it easy to navigate and enjoy.

As someone who has a hard time writing essays, this is definitely the most useful app when it comes to spewing random garbage just to satisfy your literature teachers. Not only that, but the fact that it seems to write pretty okayish in other languages (like French and Romanian, uncertain about Japanese and Chinese which are the usual languages that get confusing for AI) - definitely worth it, especially the fact that you can do what you need to do without paying money :)

it would have been five stars if we were able to click pictures of our questions and send those to chatgpt beachse some questions are diagrams. Plus it gives me so many wrong answers and when I point it out, it immediately corrects them or says another wrong option. Or sometimes when It gives an answer, I tell it thats wrong, and it changes it's originally correct answerðŸ™„, so disappointed. Also the developers don't even bother to reply to emails or reviews to fix the issue,like do u even care??

Talking to AI was wonderful and exciting. How he talks, and the torn of his voice was so real.But unfortunately, it is very, very limited, like 10 mins.I checked it 4 hours later, then our chat history was gone. This is so disappointing. Many users also write problems about subscriptions. So i don't pay anyways. I'm not sure that i want to keep using this app. There were no error issues today..idk tomorrow. I won't click on the 'Upgrade to Plus' button.

Certainly! Here's a review based on your feedback: Title: Great App, Missing Voice Feature I've been using the ChatGPT Android app, and overall, it's proven to be incredibly useful. The text-based interactions are smooth, and the app's capabilities are impressive. However, one aspect I found lacking is the absence of a voice feature. Having the option for voice interactions would enhance the user experience significantly. I hope the developers consider integrating this feature in future update

"I am absolutely thrilled with the ChatGPT Android app! It provides an incredible conversational experience with quick and accurate responses. The interface is user-friendly, making it easy to engage in meaningful conversations. I love the convenience of having this powerful AI language model at my fingertips, allowing me to get information, assistance, or simply have fun chats anytime, anywhere. The app's functionality.

I do miss what seems a slight pull back on the conversations, as I've enjoyed fleshing out philosophical ideas with GBT and it seems now too agreeable. Maybe I'm wrong, but I enjoyed the past conversations as too many people online are affected by different options, seeing them as an attack. This was a great outlet, maybe improve in the future? Anyway, still an amazing piece of technology. I would welcome to be able to return to past conversations, especially in a one-on-one learning environment

I've been using this AI service for quite some time, and it provides a seamless and efficient interface for all my needs. Regarding the app, the accuracy and speed of responses are truly impressive. Some features I'd love to see added to the mobile version is the ability to modify questions and conduct searches directly on the page, for refining queries and obtaining more tailored information. Also, having the option to classify requests afterward would enhance organization. Highly recommended!

it's really brilliant, I mean it's dumb as a bag of rocks sometimes, but that's fine, it's a great jumping off point, it can help form a loose idea into something with structure and flesh which you can then build on, it does a pretty good job at answering complex questions in simple ways. Just remember it cannot always be trusted, it doesn't replace your brain, it's just guides you towards what you want, you still have to do some of the work if you want a quality outcome.

Chatgpt is awesome and I've been using it since the beginning. The website I would review with 5 stars. But for the app, I have to reduce the rating by one star, as the voice recognition is too strict. As others mentioned, it used to be better in the early versions. Now, as soon as you have a short thinking pause, it's cutting off the message. So it would be really helpful to have a mode for manually stopping the voice recognition for us slow speakers. Edit: was fixed, so now five stars.

Sure, here's a sample review: "ChatGPT is an incredible language model! It provides quick and accurate responses, making it a versatile tool for various tasks. The simplicity of the app makes it easy to use, and I appreciate the vast knowledge it offers. Great job, OpenAI!" Feel free to modify it based on your experience or add any specific details you'd like to highlight.

The app stands out for its responsive AI conversations but falls short in user interface design. It lacks essential features for managing chat histories, such as the ability to multi-select and delete conversations, organize them into folders, and mark them as favorites. These limitations lead to a cluttered experience, especially for frequent users. Introducing these organizational tools would greatly enhance user experience and efficiency, making it more user-friendly and practical.

It's improved tremendously since I started using it. Obviously, the responses are as good as the prompts. But overall, it's made my workflow of generating product descriptions, bios, website content much simpler and faster, totally worth the subscription (doesn't mean OpenAi should increase the price!). Image generation is another issue. While it's great for really abstract stuff, the results can be somewhat horrifying if you ask Dall-E to create a human figure. Hope it stays safe for humanity!

A revolution! 5/5 But please, add a feature that allows to delete all the conversations at once, or at least select those you want to delete. It's very convenient to just ask a question, close the app, and then when you need it do the same thing again, but each time a new conversation is initialized, which over time creates dozens of unwanted chats that must be deleted individually, which is pretty inconvenient.

Update 2: A read aloud feature was added and its amazing. But it has a bug where sometimes in the middle of reading a reply, it will just jump back to the beginning and start reading afresh. Overall, good App experience sofar. The UI still needs some sort of way to visually distinguish between prompts and replies. Right now everything looks flat with no visual differentiation.

ChatGPT is an absolute game-changer! It's like having a brilliant companion who anticipates your every need and provides solutions before you even ask. Its lightning-fast responses and unparalleled accuracy have completely transformed how I navigate the digital world. ChatGPT isn't just an app; it's a marvel of modern technology that has elevated my productivity and enriched my life in ways I never thought possible. Thank you, ChatGPT, for being the epitome of excellence in the AI landscape!

It can create many things, helping people study and learn. It isn't perfect yet as it can still make mistakes. I hope they can keep making it better. It's an awesome app and life changer. It sums up all the information available on the internet in a single response. It is brilliant but still needs to be guided on the response you need. Add additional questions and instructions to ensure optimal outcome. Verify response with other sources as some information might be incorrect. Limited in the sense that it is a language model and cannot provide graphs or images. Does not replace human factor in writing responses. Too artificial at times.

ChatGPT is an incredible app that delivers lightning-fast responses. In the past, writing equations using LaTeX was a bit challenging and not conducive to studying. However, with the recent update, equations are now displayed in plain text, making it a lifesaver for my study sessions. I highly recommend ChatGPT for its efficiency and user-friendly features.

The app is really helpful and the voice chat option is just perfect for the times when you don't wanna read out the text. it is a really amazing way of getting information and finding solutions to your problems. the only announcement thing is that the chats are available when you scroll up, and just disappear in a short span of time, and you have to search up to the accessibility bar. I hope that this could be improved

ChatGPT has been a game-changer for me! It's incredibly versatile and intelligent, making every interaction a pleasure. The interface is sleek and easy to use, seamlessly integrating into my daily routine. Whether I need quick answers or creative inspiration, ChatGPT always delivers with precision. Its reliability and depth of knowledge make it an indispensable tool in my life. Written using GPT himself xD. Tho it's honesty time saving and game changer. Love it !

This is really great, the haptics and everything. The responses sometimes fall short and sometimes it isn't as efficient as GPT-4 and mixes things up or just repeats my question back to me in a statement or in a different format not asked for. So yeah and for my studies, this is a life saver. [Edit : recent updates have made the app slower, probably to force us to buy the premium :-( ]

ChatGPT has become my go-to app for stimulating conversations and quick information. Whether I'm looking to learn something new, brainstorm ideas, or just engage in friendly banter, ChatGPT never disappoints. Its diverse knowledge base and natural language processing capabilities make every interaction seamless and enjoyable. Plus, the AI's ability to adapt to different topics and moods keeps the conversation going.

Edit: App has not been loading for days now. Just shows a spinner despite being a paying customer. The previous issue mentioned below also still exists. Would be 5 stars except it is missing essential functionality. Without Edit chatgpt will go off on tangents and you will spend the rest of the conversation polluting the context in order to bring it back on track. Edit is the perfect fix to this problem, but for some crazy reason this feature was excluded from the Android app.

I've found this app incredibly helpful with a user-friendly interface that streamlines my tasks. However, there is a room for enhancement. adding features like picture uploads for problem-solving, and different accent voice replies and customisation on voice replies would enhance the experience and versatility. These additions would significantly enhance the user experience. Overall, I highly recommend this app and look forward to seeing these updates in future!

Don't subscribe!!! Chat GPT Plus charged me twice for my subscription, and I still can't access my account for an urgent project. I've reached out multiple times for help, but no response yet. Past experiences show their support can take up to four months to reply. This delay is unacceptable. If you're considering subscribing, think twice! They need to fix these issues fast. If there's an issue with your subscription there will be no means to quickly fix it due to unavailable customer service.

As a free user of ChatGPT 3.5, I've found it to be an incredibly useful tool for generating text and getting quick answers to my questions. Its ability to understand context and provide relevant responses is impressive. However, I wish there were more customization options available for tailoring the responses to my specific needs, such as editing my prompts. Overall, ChatGPT is an invaluable resource that I rely on daily for various tasks and inquiries.

I recently started using ChatGPT, and I must say, it has exceeded my expectations in every way possible. The app keeps crashing on my phone, the voice chat is difficult to even use as a whole, and to keep turning it off when I have no intent of using it. But otherwise it works fine. Beats everything and anything a regular browser could accommodate you with. Plus, help pretty well with fact-checking my essays and correcting some of their grammatical errors.
